visualization_prompt: Generate a column chart showing monthly sales performance across product categories using synthetic data with quarterly seasonality and brand-aligned color encoding
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12 monthly observations of synthetic sales figures (univariate time series). Synthetic values were generated with μ=168k, σ=20k, incorporating Q4 seasonality (+15% Nov-Dec) and summer demand patterns. Data integrity was maintained through range constraints (min=142k, max=205k) reflecting typical B2C sales cycles. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while using position-aligned labeling for precise value estimation. Cairo's color principles were applied through a perceptually uniform palette that maintains discriminability under grayscale conversion. Proportional encoding through column height leverages human visual perception's linear response to 2D area comparisons. Statistical anchors include synthetic variance (σ²=400M) and seasonal effect sizes modeled on retail industry patterns.
